result.execSummary:
The defendant Vernon Parrott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.
Expungment 973.015 if successfully completes probation and all fines and costs are paid in full and on time.

Anger managment classes.
Letter of apology within 30 days through Agent.
Only incidental contact at school with Joshua D. unless victim requests the no contact be waived.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: All financials same as noted above.
All other conditions, including expungment are the same as noted in Count 1.

ADDRESS INFO for Vernon Parrott
Current: P O Box 442, 203 Cedar St, Tigerton, WI 54486   (Effective: 03-11-2015)
Prior: 203 Cedar St P O Box 442, Tigerton, WI 54486

Defendant enters a plea of no contest to both counts.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Joint recommendation:  Withhold sentence, 1 year probation with conditions and expungment if successfully completes probation & pays fines & costs on time.  Arguments by Attny Weerts.  Defendant apologizes.  2 letters of support from the school submitted to the Court.  Court accepts joint recommendation.

no presence on Tigerton School grounds, unless administration allows. no contact with victim directly or indirectly. no communication or violent contact with witnesses. follow Tigerton High School Rules. prior court approval needed if he moves

No presence on Tigerton School grounds unless administration allows.  No contact with victim directly or indirectly.  No communication or violent contact with witnesses.  Follow Tigerton High School Rules.  Prior court approval needed if he moves.
Defendant Vernon Parrott appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Gregory A. Parker appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
